noun.description: A destructive fungal disease of apple and other trees that results in damage to the bark.
An ulcerous condition or disease of a human or animal.
A malign and corrupting influence that is difficult to eradicate.
examples: racism remains a canker at the heart of the nation

verb.description: (of woody plant tissue) become infected with canker.
examples: we found some cankering of the wood

verb.description: Infected with a pervasive and corrupting bitterness.
examples: he hated her with a cankered, shameful abhorrence

origin: Middle English (denoting a tumor): from Old French chancre, from Latin cancer crab (see cancer).
